{"command":["bash","-lc","set -euo pipefail
whoami
pwd
ls -la ~ | sed -n '1,120p'
# æ¢ç´¢å¯¾è±¡ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ä¸€è¦§
paths=(~/.zshrc ~/.zshenv ~/.zprofile ~/.zlogin ~/.zlogout)
for p in "${paths[@]}"; do
  if [[ -f "$p" ]]; then echo "--- $p"; sed -n '1,200p' "$p"; fi
done
# include ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªï¼ˆã‚ˆãã‚ã‚‹åˆ†å‰²å‹ï¼‰ã‚‚æ¢ç´¢
for d in ~/.zsh ~/.zshrc.d ~/.config/zsh ~/.config/shell ~/.config; do
  if [[ -d "$d" ]]; then echo "### DIR: $d"; rg -n "^(alias |alias\s+|c=|^c\()|cursor|codex|\bc \(" "$d" || true; fi
done
# dotfiles ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªå€™è£œã‚’æ¢ç´¢
for d in ~/dotfiles ~/.dotfiles ~/src/dotfiles ~/workspace/dotfiles ~/Work/dotfiles; do
  if [[ -d "$d" ]]; then echo "### DOTFILES CANDIDATE: $d"; rg -n "alias c=|cursor|codex|zshrc|symlink" "$d" || true; fi
done
"],"timeout_ms":120000}

# fzfã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–ãªgitæ“ä½œ

# gcoã§fzfã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒã‚’é¸æŠ
gco() {
  if [[ $# -eq 0 ]]; then
    # å¼•æ•°ãªã—ã®å ´åˆã¯fzfã§ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒã‚’é¸æŠ
    local branch
    branch=$(git branch -a | grep -v HEAD | sed 's/.* //' | sed 's#remotes/[^/]*/##' | sort -u | \
      fzf --preview 'git log --oneline --graph --date=short --color=always --pretty="format:%C(auto)%cd %h%d %s" {} | head -20' \
          --preview-window right:60%:wrap \
          --header 'Select branch to checkout' \
          --height 70% \
          --ansi)
    if [[ -n "$branch" ]]; then
      git checkout "$branch"
    fi
  else
    # å¼•æ•°ãŒã‚ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯é€šå¸¸ã®checkout
    git checkout "$@"
  fi
}

# gaã§fzfã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’é¸æŠã—ã¦add
ga() {
  if [[ $# -eq 0 ]]; then
    # å¼•æ•°ãªã—ã®å ´åˆã¯fzfã§å¤‰æ›´ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’é¸æŠ
    local files
    files=$(git status -s | grep -E '^\s*[AMRD?]' | \
      fzf --multi --preview 'git diff --color=always {2} | head -200' \
          --preview-window right:60%:wrap \
          --header 'Select files to add (TAB for multi-select)' \
          --height 70% \
          --ansi | awk '{print $2}')
    if [[ -n "$files" ]]; then
      echo "$files" | xargs git add
      git status -s
    fi
  else
    # å¼•æ•°ãŒã‚ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯é€šå¸¸ã®add
    git add "$@"
  fi
}

# gshã§fzfã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦stashã‚’ç®¡ç†
gsh() {
  if [[ $# -eq 0 ]] && [[ $(git stash list | wc -l) -gt 0 ]]; then
    # stashãŒã‚ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯é¸æŠã—ã¦apply/pop/drop
    local stash
    local action
    stash=$(git stash list | \
      fzf --preview 'git stash show -p $(echo {} | cut -d: -f1) | head -200' \
          --preview-window right:60%:wrap \
          --header 'Select stash' \
          --height 70% \
          --ansi)
    if [[ -n "$stash" ]]; then
      stash_ref=$(echo "$stash" | cut -d: -f1)
      echo "Selected: $stash"
      echo "What would you like to do?"
      echo "1) pop   - Apply and remove from stash list"
      echo "2) apply - Apply but keep in stash list" 
      echo "3) drop  - Remove without applying"
      echo "4) show  - Show details"
      read -r "action?Enter choice (1-4): "
      case "$action" in
        1) git stash pop "$stash_ref" ;;
        2) git stash apply "$stash_ref" ;;
        3) git stash drop "$stash_ref" ;;
        4) git stash show -p "$stash_ref" ;;
        *) echo "Cancelled" ;;
      esac
    fi
  else
    # é€šå¸¸ã®stashã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰
    git stash "$@"
  fi
}

# gcpã§fzfã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã‚³ãƒŸãƒƒãƒˆã‚’é¸æŠã—ã¦cherry-pick
gcp() {
  if [[ $# -eq 0 ]]; then
    # å¼•æ•°ãªã—ã®å ´åˆã¯fzfã§ã‚³ãƒŸãƒƒãƒˆã‚’é¸æŠ
    local commit
    commit=$(git log --all --oneline --graph --color=always --decorate | \
      fzf --ansi --preview 'git show --color=always $(echo {} | grep -o "[a-f0-9]\{7,\}" | head -1) | head -200' \
          --preview-window right:60%:wrap \
          --header 'Select commit to cherry-pick' \
          --height 70%)
    if [[ -n "$commit" ]]; then
      local hash=$(echo "$commit" | grep -o "[a-f0-9]\{7,\}" | head -1)
      git cherry-pick "$hash"
    fi
  else
    # å¼•æ•°ãŒã‚ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯é€šå¸¸ã®cherry-pick
    git cherry-pick "$@"
  fi
}

# gbrã§fzfã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒã‚’ç®¡ç†
gbr() {
  if [[ $# -eq 0 ]]; then
    # å¼•æ•°ãªã—ã®å ´åˆã¯fzfã§ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒã‚’é¸æŠã—ã¦å‰Šé™¤

# 5. Install Node.js tools
if ! command -v pnpm &> /dev/null; then
    print_status "Installing pnpm..."
    curl -fsSL https://get.pnpm.io/install.sh | sh -
    print_success "pnpm installed"
fi

# 6. Backup existing configs
print_status "Backing up existing configurations..."
backup_dir="$HOME/.dotfiles_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
mkdir -p "$backup_dir"

configs_to_backup=(
    ".zshrc"
    ".gitconfig"
    ".gitignore_global"
    ".tmux.conf"
    ".vimrc"
)

for config in "${configs_to_backup[@]}"; do
    if [[ -f "$HOME/$config" ]]; then
        cp "$HOME/$config" "$backup_dir/"
        print_success "Backed up $config"
    fi
done

# 7. Create necessary directories
print_status "Creating necessary directories..."
mkdir -p "$HOME/.config"
mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/bin"
mkdir -p "$HOME/.npm-global"

# 8. Install dotfiles
print_status "Installing dotfiles..."

# Shell configurations
if [[ -f "shell/zshrc" ]]; then
    cp shell/zshrc "$HOME/.zshrc"
    print_success "Installed .zshrc"
fi

if [[ -f "shell/tmux.conf" ]]; then
    cp shell/tmux.conf "$HOME/.tmux.conf"
    print_success "Installed .tmux.conf"
fi

# Git configurations
if [[ -f "git/gitconfig" ]]; then
    cp git/gitconfig "$HOME/.gitconfig"
    print_success "Installed .gitconfig"
fi

if [[ -f "git/gitignore_global" ]]; then
    cp git/gitignore_global "$HOME/.gitignore_global"
    print_success "Installed .gitignore_global"
fi

# Support files
if [[ -f "completion-for-pnpm.zsh" ]]; then
    cp completion-for-pnpm.zsh "$HOME/completion-for-pnpm.zsh"
    print_success "Installed pnpm completion"
fi

# 9. Install Cursor settings
if command -v cursor &> /dev/null || [[ -d "$HOME/Library/Application Support/Cursor" ]]; then
    print_status "Installing Cursor settings..."
    cursor_dir="$HOME/Library/Application Support/Cursor"
    
    if [[ ! -d "$cursor_dir" ]]; then
        mkdir -p "$cursor_dir/User"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f "cursor/User/settings.json" ]]; then
        cp cursor/User/settings.json "$cursor_dir/User/"
        print_success "Installed Cursor settings.json"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f "cursor/User/keybindings.json" ]]; then
        cp cursor/User/keybindings.json "$cursor_dir/User/"
        print_success "Installed Cursor keybindings.json"
    fi
    
    if [[ -d "cursor/User/snippets" ]]; then
        cp -r cursor/User/snippets "$cursor_dir/User/"
        print_success "Installed Cursor snippets"
    fi
else
    print_warning "Cursor not installed, skipping Cursor settings"
fi

# 10. Install other application settings
print_status "Installing other application settings..."

# Karabiner
if [[ -d "$HOME/.config/karabiner" ]]; then
    if [[ -f "karabiner/karabiner.json" ]]; then
        cp karabiner/karabiner.json "$HOME/.config/karabiner/"
        print_success "Installed Karabiner configuration"
    fi
    if [[ -d "karabiner/assets" ]]; then
        cp -r karabiner/assets "$HOME/.config/karabiner/"
        print_success "Installed Karabiner assets"
    fi
fi

# Neovim
if command -v nvim &> /dev/null; then
    mkdir -p "$HOME/.config/nvim"
    if [[ -d "nvim" ]]; then
        cp -r nvim/* "$HOME/.config/nvim/"
        print_success "Installed Neovim configuration"
    fi
fi

# WezTerm
if command -v wezterm &> /dev/null || [[ -d "$HOME/.config/wezterm" ]]; then
    mkdir -p "$HOME/.config/wezterm"
    if [[ -d "wezterm" ]]; then
        cp wezterm/*.lua "$HOME/.config/wezterm/"
        print_success "Installed WezTerm configuration"
    fi
fi

**Updating dotfiles process**

The current sync-dotfiles.sh appears to effectively sync from HOME to the repository, which is great. It excludes sensitive information like SSH keys and tokens, so thatâ€™s a relief. I think we should update the README and install.sh to clarify that the repository wonâ€™t overwrite existing configurations on the machine, except during installations. It might be helpful to create an umbrella script, "update-dotfiles.sh," that combines syncing and pushing with an automatic timestamped commit message for convenience.

**Implementing dotfiles updates**

I could add a script and alias in the zshrc, but I want to minimize changes. I'll create an `update-dotfiles.sh` in the root directory that first calls sync and then push. We should also check that the .gitignore excludes sensitive information to keep it private. The existing README and alias mapping need review. Iâ€™ll include an alias for `dotupdate` in the .zshrc, while ensuring that install.sh still copies files from the repo to the machine when setting up. I'll also update the README to clarify that the source of truth is the machine.

**Implementing dotfiles updates**

I'm planning to implement a few changes. First, Iâ€™ll create an `update-dotfiles.sh` script that runs sync-dotfiles.sh and then push-dotfiles.sh, including a commit message with the current date and time. I'll also update the .zshrc file to add an alias for `dotupdate` pointing to this script. 

Next, Iâ€™ll refine `sync-dotfiles.sh` to include additional configuration files, particularly `.wezterm.lua`, since it already syncs from the user's `.config/wezterm`. We might also need to check if the `.hyper.js` and `.hyper_plugins` files are necessary.

**Updating sync for configurations**

Currently, the sync process copies configurations from `/.config/wezterm`, but if the user only uses `/.wezterm.lua`, changes might not be captured. I see they have a `/.config/wezterm` directory, but to be safe, I'll modify the sync to also copy `/.wezterm.lua` into `repo/wezterm/wezterm.lua` if it exists. 

Iâ€™ll also include `.hyper.js` into `repo/hyper/hyper.js` since the repository appears to have a hyper folder. Let's verify that!
